Art. 4.5. 
Condition of survival
 To be entitled to inherit, the person must survive the deceased.
 Where the order in which two or more persons died cannot be determined, they are deemed to have died simultaneously.
 If, as a result of circumstances for which he cannot be held responsible, a person concerned has difficulty in establishing the order of death, the judge may grant him one or more time limits, provided that it is reasonable to assume that proof can be produced within these time limits.
